MemberSignature.Value: static member CalculateLength : Java.Lang.ICharSequence * bool -> int[]
public static int[]? CalculateLength (Java.Lang.ICharSequence? messageBody, bool use7bitOnly);
.method public static hidebysig int32[] CalculateLength(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence messageBody, bool use7bitOnly) cil managed

Docs.param: if true, characters that are not part of the GSM alphabet are counted as a single space char. If false, a messageBody containing non-GSM alphabet characters is calculated for 16-bit encoding.
Docs.summary: Calculates the number of SMS's required to encode the message body and the number of characters remaining until the next message, given the current encoding.
Docs.returns: an int[4] with int[0] being the number of SMS's required, int[1] the number of code units used, and int[2] is the number of code units remaining until the next message. int[3] is the encoding type that should be used for the message.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public static hidebysig int32[] CalculateLength(string messageBody, bool use7bitOnly) cil managed

Docs.param: if true, characters that are not part of the GSM alphabet are counted as a single space char. If false, a messageBody containing non-GSM alphabet characters is calculated for 16-bit encoding.
Docs.summary: Calculates the number of SMS's required to encode the message body and the number of characters remaining until the next message, given the current encoding.
Docs.returns: an int[4] with int[0] being the number of SMS's required, int[1] the number of code units used, and int[2] is the number of code units remaining until the next message. int[3] is the encoding type that should be used for the message.

Docs.param: Service Centre address. Null means use default.
Docs.summary: Get an SMS-SUBMIT PDU for a destination address and a message
Docs.returns: a SubmitPdu containing the encoded SC address, if applicable, and the encoded message. Returns null on encode error.

format.a: Java documentation for android.telephony.gsm.SmsMessage.getSubmitPdu(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, boolean).

the port to deliver the message to at the destination
Service Centre address. Null means use default.

Docs.summary: Returns the record index of the message on the SIM (1-based index).
Docs.value: the record index of the message on the SIM, or -1 if this SmsMessage was not created from a SIM SMS EF record.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns true for CPHS MWI toggle message.
Docs.value: true if this is a CPHS MWI toggle message See CPHS 4.2 section B.4.2

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns true if message is an email.
Docs.value: true if this message came through an email gateway and email sender / subject / parsed body are available

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: returns true if this message is a CPHS voicemail / message waiting indicator (MWI) clear message

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: returns true if this message is a "Message Waiting Indication Group: Discard Message" notification and should not be stored.

Docs.summary: returns true if this message is a CPHS voicemail / message waiting indicator (MWI) set message

Docs.summary: Returns the address of the SMS service center that relayed this message or null if there is none.

Docs.summary: GSM: For an SMS-STATUS-REPORT message, this returns the status field from the status report.
Docs.value: 0 indicates the previously sent message was received. See TS 23.040, 9.9.2.3.15 and C.S0015-B, v2.0, 4.5.21 for a description of other possible values.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the status of the message on the SIM (read, unread, sent, unsent).
Docs.value: the status of the message on the SIM. These are: SmsManager.STATUS_ON_SIM_FREE SmsManager.STATUS_ON_SIM_READ SmsManager.STATUS_ON_SIM_UNREAD SmsManager.STATUS_ON_SIM_SEND SmsManager.STATUS_ON_SIM_UNSENT
